title: Augusta: William F. Brand to Kate Armentrout, May 25, 1861
summary: Brand writes to Kate of picket duty, arriving troops from other states, and her friends and family in camp. He also shares some rumors of the Union occupation of Alexandria, and says that every member of the Augusta Grays who voted in the recent elections voted in favor of secession.
keywords: Camp Life, Enlistment, Family, Patriotism, Troop Movement, American Civil War
